page.title: 09The Lee Flower Show
page.content: This is a village event, on the 3rd Saturday in July. It started in 1893 as the Squire's Sunday School Sports, & is now run by a committee of local people. The Lee Cricket Field is used for the {site}& 2 marquees are hired from Marks Bros., the larger for both flower show & art & craft show. Homemade teas are sold from the other. The display of hard work throughout the preceding year, races for all ages & a brass band are the main{ {attractions.} Flowers, vegetables, cookery & handicrafts are{exhibited}in competition by local residents. There are also special classes for children. The Show is {financed}by small entry fees for adult classes & a fee charged for site entry, but most of the money is raised through sideshows & business displays. Money prizes are given & the committee only aims to cover costs.
